You can't really beat him, assuming all he has are armor/MR/health items. Unless Nasus' whole team is completely throwing every teamfight, I don't see how you can win.

The point is to deny him farm, and focus him the whole lane phase, don't take down his lane towers lest you give him free farm.

I would argue the opposite actually. The best way to deny him stacks after the first 5-10 minutes is not by staying in lane and trying to zone or harass him. It's by taking tower early and pressuring the rest of the map. Either:
a) you take a bunch of towers/kills/dragons and get a massive gold lead for your team while he farms his q
b) he tries to push top and get your tower, which means he doesnt get that many stacks
c) he tp's/roams to help his team and doesnt get any farm or stacks

having 400 stacks by 20 minutes isn't enough to carry the game if his team is getting crushed

If you're in bronze or something where the game will go on for 40+ minutes regardless, just play darius or something and kill him repeatedly (and his jungler if he comes) until his team starts flaming him for being useless.

That's not going to work as well as you might think.

The roaming has to pay off or else Nasus will be getting free farm at top for nothing.

I've seen many Nasus games were he rejects the pleas for help from his team and still keeps stacking and mid game he destroys everyone.

It's better to harass him with champions that can take his Q damage or kite him, Vayne/Quinn. You can also take Pantheon to negate his Q damage pretty much completely.

I used to play a lot of nasus. once it gets to the 10-15 minute mark, he will have a defensive item and will outsustain most poke and is going to free farm whether you're in lane or not. Continuing to devote resources to keep him down will only be moderately successful and will make it significantly more likely for your team to lose on the rest of map.

And the champions you listed are all VERY risky. Vayne and quinn are both easy to gank and are going to get crushed if they get behind and pantheon is even MORE reliant on roaming after 6 since his ult is useless in lane and he will actually lose all ins unless he already got several kills (plus his shield is never going to block a q unless the nasus sucks, its easy to pop it with a normal auto first).

If you leave him in lane for 10 minutes and fail to get an advantage for your team, it's not because nasus is op, it's because you weren't able to take advantage of being 5v4 on the rest of the map and you probably deserve to lose that game. Nasus is just better than most at punishing people for wasting time and not taking advantage when they can.

If you are complaining about the amount of stacks Nasus has when he hits you, it should do more than that to him. The only real drawback to the thornmail is that ADCs and APCs can't really throw it into their build without sacrificing power, but then again Nasus is usually top so that shouldn't be a big problem.

Vayne/Kog'Maw are good counters for Nasus even in late game. Take QSS as vayne so you can remove his slow, and then simply kite him around ripping chunks of his health off every third hit, or kog'maw does his thing IDK all i know is Kog has %hp damage.

Vi also works pretty well against nasus. Build her slightly tankier than normal, BORK and Tri-force as only AD items and just stick to him like glue if he's fed or has high stacks. Your armor and HP shred as Vi should allow your Mages and/or ADC to pick him apart piece by piece. Take thornmail as Vi and you redirect 30% of his huge Q as magic damage back to him.
i know but usally people go nasus top and people go melee not ranged
Those are his counters though, and vayne and Kog can be played in top.

As a nasus main myself, I see why people hate him. Nasus thrives in a 1v1 mid-late scenario
The idea is to deny his farm early and try to hit 6 way before he does because after that point, he becomes extremely difficult to kill without assistance.
